no_pre_diagnosed_diabetes.recommendations: Your fasting blood glucose level is raised. This suggests the possibility of diabetes. An Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT) and HbA1c test are recommended. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
Your HbA1c level is raised. This suggests the possibility of pre-diabetes. An Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT) is recommended. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

Your fasting blood glucose level is raised, but your HbA1c level is within normal limits. This suggests the possibility of pre-diabetes. A repeat fasting glucose test or Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT) is  recommended. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

pre_diagnosed_diabetes.recommendations: Your fasting blood glucose level is high. This suggests the possibility of sub-optimally controlled diabetes. A review of your current treatment is recommended. Dietary changes and regular exercise can help improve your blood glucose level. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

Your HbA1c level is high. This is suggestive of sub-optimally controlled diabetes. A review of your current treatment is recommended. Dietary changes and regular exercise can help improve your HbA1c level. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.

Your HbA1c level is high. This is suggestive of poorly controlled diabetes. A review of your current treatment is recommended. Dietary changes and regular exercise can help improve your HbA1c level. Please consult our doctor for further medical advice.
